text: The men's single sculls competition at the 2018 World Rowing Championships in Plovdiv took place at the Plovdiv Regatta Venue. ==Schedule== The schedule was as follows: {| class="wikitable" ! Date ! Time ! Round |- | Sunday 9 September 2018 || 12:17 || Heats |- | Monday 10 September 2018 || 12:01 || Repechages |- | rowspan=3|Thursday 13 September 2018 || 09:49 || Quarterfinals |- | 16:37 || Semifinals C/D |- | 17:25 || Semifinals E/F |- | Friday 14 September 2018 || 09:51 || Semifinals A/B |- | rowspan=3|Saturday 15 September 2018 || 16:21 || Final D |- | 16:45 || Final E |- | 16:53 || Final F |- | rowspan=3|Sunday 16 September 2018 || 09:38 || Final C |- | 10:38 || Final B |- | style=background:lemonchiffon| 12:04 ||style=background:lemonchiffon| Final A |} All times are Eastern European Summer Time (UTC+3) ==Results== ===Heats=== The three fastest boats in each heat advanced directly to the quarterfinals. | SC/D |} ===Semifinals E/F=== The two fastest boats in semi 1 and three in semi 2 were sent to the E final. The remaining boats were sent to the F final. ====Semifinals 1==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rower !Country !Time !Notes |- | 1 | align="left"|Abdelkhalek El-Banna | align="left"| | 7:27.82 | FE |- | 2 | align="left"|Methasit Phromphoem | align="left"| | 7:59.89 | FE |- | 3 | align="left"|Rillio Rii | align="left"| | 8:12.68 | FF |} ====Semifinals 2==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rower !Country !Time !Notes |- | 1 | align="left"|Andrei Jämsä | align="left"| | 7:47.01 | FE |- | 2 | align="left"|Oleksandr Lukianenko | align="left"| | 7:50.66 | FE |- | 3 | align="left"|Arturo Rivarola | align="left"| | 7:56.41 | FE |- | 4 | align="left"|Privel Hinkati | align="left"| | 8:08.70 | FF |} ===Semifinals C/D=== The three fastest boats in each semi advanced to the C final.
